campaign.story:
PLAY

While waiting for this to pass ~ The things we didn’t use ~ I can’t even remember who won ~ A place from previous tales 
You have just read the titles of my four-part photobook, a long term art project, an intimate research and visual notes.
The personal photographic records gathered in these volumes represent segments of the world yet are the imaginary and narrative entirety of my artistic practice – an intuitive-analytical view of situations, relationships, people, the predictable and the unpredictable.
I try to take you, the reader, along in my journey into modalities of Everyday, its established social choreographies and the visual language these relations sprout.
The first two volumes consist of photos taken in the period of the global lockdown due to COVID-19. It is a creative process developed during the period of limited activity and outings. The images question reality from a passive, restrained standpoint where the world is only as large as our view permits it to be.
Photo from the book “While waiting for this to pass”
~ While waiting for this to pass [Dok smo čekali da sve ovo prođe] is an upward view from the earth and memories, a view toward a segment of sky, calling for our exploration. The perceived flow of time can seem as a repetitive and continuous feeling of confinement and impaired movement.
~ The things we didn’t use [Stvari koje nismo koristili] is a return to the place and time we are confined to, the quarantine – a moment of reduced living conditions in which one searches for new meaning.
The next two volumes consist of photos taken in the period between 2016 and the beginning of 2020. They are reflective details of the Everyday, the situations and processes intrinsic to it. These photographic notes reference seemingly generic images, signposts of past emotions, with which we try to recall the world as it was (or as it is). The poetry of those times is transformed today, when we are contrived to consider that caring can mean isolation, and freedom of movement, a risk. Each part of the photobook inevitably provides us with an opportunity to take time to explore each frozen frame in its entirety and establish our own existence within the world.
Photo from the book "I can’t even remember who won"
~ I can’t even remember who won [Više se ne sjećam tko je pobijedio] is about a birthday celebration. It analyses the situational togetherness and camaraderie that can be interpreted as a kind of finished past tense; it’s an album of habits that have since become an arena of questions on boundaries, risk, freedom.
~ A place from previous tales [Mjesto o kojem sam već pričao] is a collection of photo-notes from various journeys. In these times we live in, the question arises: are these photo-notes of illusions, of some utopian time of freedom and movement, or a possible future?
This is my intimate journey I will continue to expand on, adding new segments to the open-ended structure of this collection. Each expansion should seamlessly connect to the rest, and strengthen the whole. 
Size comparison: An egg, "I can’t even remember who won", A beer bottle (0,33l)
All four parts are made in the same format, with the same care: 
SIZE ~ 21x14.8 cm
VOLUME ~ 36 pages
PHOTOGRAPHS ~ From 21 to 25 in each volume
INSIDE PAPER ~ Conqueror Connoisseur 100% cotton, Soft White, 110g
COVER PAPER ~ Keaykolour 100% Recycled, Particles Snow, 300g
BINDING ~ Hand-bound with a simple white seam down the middle
LANGUAGE ~ Croatian, with English translations on the last page of each volume.
Hand-bound with a simple seam down the middle
Detail of the seam
The purpose of this campaign
My wish is to offer a unique experience where my journey intertwines with yours while you explore the photobook as it connects with your own story. The photograph is only part of the journey. How it is printed and bound together, is another key part. 
Currently all volumes are printed digitally, but my plan is to have the final collection done in offset or digital offset, depending on the amount of people supporting the project. I have chosen what would most appropriately suit this intimate exposure and new relationship I form with you through this creation. My wish is to print 100 special editions of the four-part photobook.
The photobook collection in space
About the photographer
My name is Karlo Čargonja. I was born in Rijeka in 1987 and I’ve been doing photography since high school.
In 2013 I went to one of Saša Kralj’s photography workshops and have since educated myself in photography by way of reading and researching the industry, while attending other, relevant workshops. In 2014, Tod Papageorge, an esteemed professor at Yale University, USA, was chosen as the lead judge in the selection process for the Rovinj Photodays, which is why I’ve decided to enter the contest and was later chosen as one of the finalists in the international competition. That same year I mentored, along with Saša Kralj and Dalibor Talajić, the Multimedia workshop as part of the 6th edition of the International Photography Festival Organ Vida. I’ve been a member of the Creative Cluster KOMBINAT since its inception and have launched Talks about Photography as part of one of its first big projects. They are now held monthly in the Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art in Rijeka.
I would like to give a big thanks to my friends, without whom this campaign wouldn’t be possible:
Cyrille Cartier, Goran Ferčec, Tomica Grubiša, Sanda Hunjak, Saša Kralj, Ivona Miloš, Japanski Premijeri, Sara Salamon, Anja Sušanj, Ivan Vranjić.

campaign.story:
You would do anything for your kids, right? What if you could do everything for them, in less than 15 minutes a day?

We have recently opened discussions with a U.S. based television producer to develop a "Superpower Your Kids" broadcast special for PBS. It’s a long way to go before it is a) green-lit, and b) runs, but it’s the key first step and very exciting!




We’ve all got our kids at home during this crazy isolation time we’re living through. As parents, we want to engage with our kids, inspire, teach and help them. But sometimes we run short on ideas, low on energy, and could use a little help.


Teach your kids a single new thing each day through Lesson Games, taking as little as a minute and no more than 15. These mini lessons are designed like a flexible syllabus and presented with some professorial tricks to make them more fun and to better stick. This system uses a proven, scientific approach--including techniques used by Nobel Prize winners--to teach and empower young children. Take a big, complicated thing to learn and break it down into manageable, bite-sized pieces, scaled to whatever each child can handle...and enjoy. Because this is about playing first (in an educational way) and the learning is a powerful side effect!

PLAY



This project is LIMITED EDITION. At the moment, there are no plans to publish this book for anyone beyond the backers on Kickstarter during this campaign. So this may be YOUR ONLY CHANCE to get Superpower Your Kids!

“A new approach to inspiring a love of learning in young children… Dr Charney borrows techniques used by Nobel Prize winners and his approach as a university professor and creates a system suitable for fun, engaging “lessonlets” with kids” -Christine C,, parenting and lifestyle columnist 
“When I first discovered Prof Noah Charney's forthcoming book and app, Superpower Your Kids, I couldn't help but be excited. I mean, lockdown is definitely showing me flames and it made me realize that I do not have the capacity to sufficiently educate my kids, while doing a full day of work AND looking after our home, all at the same time. Prof Charney's book basically teaches you skills that enables you to school your kids in just 15 minutes per day. How rad?!” -Luchae W., parenting blogger, My Spreadsheet Brain 
“Parents need and deserve this book.” -Lea M., family therapist, mother of 4, author of Connect to Your Teenager 
"What does a best-selling author do during quarantine? He writes the book he wasn’t allowed to during normal time." -Thrive Global
My name is Noah Charney. I’m a professor, presenter, columnist and best-selling author of more than a dozen books. Most importantly, I’m a father, but in this case the professor, TV presenter and author parts come in handy.
For years, I’ve been preparing a book based on a unique approach I have to teaching my young daughters. This time of self-isolation, when we are all at home with our kids and could use a little inspiration, led me to write it now and make it available to all, as quickly as possible.
The result is Superpower Your Kids: A Professor’s Guide to Teaching Children Everything in Just 15 Minutes a Day.  It’s a handbook for proactive parents, unlocking a new way to approach teaching at home: as a game. Each new game teaches your kids a new miniature lesson, a "lessonlet." And each lesson, once learned, gives your kids a new superpower. These superpowers come through a combination of knowledge and empowerment which is the result of attention from you parents while you play games with your kids.

Noah has written for, or been featured in, these fine publications.

My superpower is that I’m a Dad who knows how to teach and to make the act of learning feel easy, painless, even fun. I practice with my kids every day. This book will help you do the same.


Corona Time has pushed me to write Superpower Your Kids publish it quickly—hence this being self-published, which I normally do not do, as my dozen-plus books have been published by major houses and have been international best-sellers. But traditional publishers simply could not turn around a book quickly enough for it to come out during this time of isolation, which is ideal for getting started with your kids. 
Superpower Your Kids and make this isolation time count by starting a new, empowering learning tradition that you can carry forward throughout their childhood. Kick off a lifetime love of learning. Give your kids a gift a day—knowledge that will empower them and bring you and your kids closer.



Superpower Your Kids on Instagram
Superpower Your Kids on Facebook



Superpower Menu: Over 365 Suggested Activities
The Rules of the Lesson Game
The Superpower Toolbox
The Preview – Engage – Review System
The Magic of 15 Minutes (or Far Less)
The Most Important Lesson in Your Child’s Life Comes in Kindergarten: Cultures of Early Childhood Education
Superpowers for Parents
Teaching Styles: American vs European and Getting the Best Out of Both
Tips for Multilingual Families or Learning New Languages
How to Travel with Your Children: Tips for Car Rides and Holidays
How to “Travel” with Your Children While Self-Isolating
The Power of Boredom: Why Letting Your Kids Get Bored Sometimes is Great for Them
Leveling Up Your Superpowers
Making Memories: Integrating the Quantified Self
Totally Legit “Cheats”
 Bonus essays by Dr James Charney (the author’s dad, a child psychiatrist) and Dr Diane Joy Charney (the author’s mom, a professor at Yale University)
 Illustrations and design by Urska Charney (the author’s super-wife)
And much more! 



Urska Charney (the superwife/supermom) will design and illustrate the book, to increase its cuteness quotient. Here are some preliminary sketches (that's Izabella, 5, on the left and Eleonora, 7, on the right, ready for takeoff)


The App is still being designed, but it will be provide: 
a journaling system perfectly integrated with the Superpower Your Kids book
allow you to save photos, videos and notes on your kids' new superpowers and progress, from starting new to "leveling up" powers they've already learned at a more basic level
keep track of your children's "cultural consumption" and "firsts" (what films they watched, books they read, the first time they ate tamales...)
It will come preloaded with the 365 lesson games, including the leveling up options, recommended in the book and more will be added. 
Parents will be able to recommend their own lesson game ideas to other parents using the App. 
There will be exclusive material, such as videos, added to the App.
It will function independently as a journaling App for what you do with your kids, but the eBook edition will be linked to it. So if you read about lesson game #247 (maybe learning to yoyo), and you try it with your kids, you can press a button on your eBook reader screen and your device will magically open the app and already know that you're doing lesson game #247 (fierce yoyo-ing), so you can just upload a photo of your kid "walking the dog" (level up #3) and you're good to go! At least, that's the plan.
The App will not contain any of the explanatory text that appears in the book, so you'll need the two together for your superpowers to fully unlock!



More About the Author
Dr Noah Charney is a professor of art history specializing in art crime and the internationally best-selling author of more than a dozen books. Born in New Haven, in the US, he has lived in Europe for the past two decades, and settled down in Slovenia, where he lives with his wife, two daughters and a hairless dog named Hubert van Eyck. Noah presents on television (with appearances on CBS, BBC and also here, Discovery, History, Nat Geo and more) and he writes regularly for numerous major publications, including The Guardian and The Washington Post.
To read more about him and his work, click here.
To read some of Noah's published articles, click here.

Noah appears on TV as a host or guest expert, on these fine channels and others.

Some of Noah's books, which have been published in more than a dozen languages and have been best-sellers in five countries.

But mostly he’s a Dad trying to give his kids all he can, all his love and as much love for learning as possible. His kids totally have superpowers…and yours do, too. He’s here to help you help them to level up and expand their superpower repertoire!

Noah in action at a TEDx event


If you want to see him speaking, here's a clip from CBS:

And if you want to see him teaching, here's a talk he gave at the Dallas Museum of Art recently:

Thank you for your support and I hope that this will inspire a lifetime of learning through Lesson Games and superpowers!


Wait, are you really still reading? Awesome. So if you're interested, here is a short sample section from Superpower Your Kids, to give you a sense of the style and approach, as it includes an example of the Lesson Game in practice!

...
These learning activities have no set rules per se, but more guidelines on how to keep the experience positive, enthusiastic, casual and un-forced. That goes both ways: don’t force your kids and don’t force yourself, as parents.
I have a very mild obsessive streak in me that keeps me productive, but I can see how it could tip into compulsive behavior that would slow me down. For instance, I cannot check email without responding immediately to everything in my inbox. Not to do so, to put off responding, makes me nervous. This is why I check email only once or twice a week (I get a lot of emails commenting with enthusiastic curiosity about the line at the bottom of my email template apologizing for my slow replies because I only check email twice a week). I map out projects and work packages in my weekly planner notebook and have empty squares next to each. I cannot bring myself to turn the page to the next week unless the squares are checked off, meaning I’ve done what I portioned myself to do that week (there’s a chapter in this book about how these eccentricities have actually made me more productive, and you’re welcome to borrow them).
I mention these quirks because you need to know what works best for you, to make teaching your kids feel manageable and never like work. You’ve already got enough work at, well, at your work. Home time should feel relaxing and fun whenever possible. So, knowing myself, I do not map out what I want to accomplish with my kids week to week, much less day to day. That would make me nervous and prompt me to push the kids to fulfill specific lessons, when in fact I want to allow them to guide what we learn about together. For this reason, I prefer to keep a long master-list—the Superpower Menu—in which I put all the ideas I get for mini lessons, our lessonlets, and then I usually don’t even refer to it. I like to know that it’s there, but I do not want to feel chained to its content, and least of all to a certain order. I only find myself referring to it when I can’t think of anything off the top of my head, and I’ll dip into the list for inspiration. I’ll also use it to try to find cross-referencing lessons, one that would logically and inspirationally follow another, and string them together.
For example, I watched the classic film, Bedknobs and Broomsticks, with my girls. They loved it, especially the “substitutiary locomotion” song and the great battle scene at the end when the friendly witch (played by a young Angela Lansbury) successfully animates a museum full of suits of armor which proceed to chase an invading Nazi squadron from a seaside English town. It’s a magical moment (literally and figuratively) and the girls were totally into it. This led me to play the Lesson Game in a number of directions inspired by what they were interested in.
· We talked about how to say “substitutiary locomotion” in a less fancy way (“replacing movement”), and why a “locomotive” is an older word for a train.
· The film features a variety of British accents including London Cockney, a polite “received pronunciation” and a sort of gangster slang. We talked about various accents in English and which they find more difficult to understand and which they could imitate.
· We talked about the suits of armor from various time periods and then browsed through a book we have of arms and armor. We looked at horse armor, described what it felt like to wear armor, how it was put on.
· The “substitutiary locomotion” spell can make inanimate objects move around on their own, as the good witch explains in the film. We talked about the difference between animate and inanimate objects. I listed things and asked my girls to tell me if they were animate or inanimate: a fish, a shoe, our dog, a hot dog, a suit of armor, a knight in armor, a photograph of a knight in armor. I was trying to be tricky, because once I saw that they grasped that animate objects were living and capable of movement, I pulled a fast one asking about a photograph of something that is animate (the photograph being inanimate). I also played with words to be tricky and playful (our dog is animate, a hot dog is inanimate).
· The film has some silly Nazi bad guys (not the scary kind) but we talked a bit about who they were, why they spoke German, and that there had been a war a long time ago—Second World War history lite, to gently inform but not over-complicate or upset a 5-year-old.
· There’s a great scene on Portobello Road in London, where the characters search for the second half of a torn book of magic. I lived in London and had been there many times, so I told them about the antiques market there, we watched a walk-through video of the market and I asked what they would be interested in looking for, if they were there.
· The film has a scene in which the children list their favorite foods, and the list sounds intriguing but confusing to non-British kids: bubble and squeak, sausage and mash, toad in the hole. So we looked up what these dishes were and cooked some for ourselves.
Those are seven mini lessons (which we’ll call “lessonlets” because the word “lesson” unfortunately has the connotation of work) that emerged from the fun of watching one film. Suddenly you’ve got your whole week’s-worth of Lesson Games laid out for you in one go. On the first night, you watch the movie together and talk about it afterward, reviewing what you saw and what stood out. Then each of the following six days, you pick one of the lessonlets above to play with together. There could be infinitely more of them, but this is to give an example of how a web of ideas can emerge from each activity.
Each of these lessonlets gives your kids a new power. Some of these powers are as simple as learning a new word. But don’t for a moment think that learning a new word is anything short of a powerful tool. Think how impressed your 7-year-old’s teacher would be if she throws in the words “substitutiary” and “locomotion” in conversation. Each new word opens up a window in your child’s imagination palace, letting in light and allowing them to see out in a way they never could before they learned that word. The world around them becomes fractionally clearer. The next time they encounter the word they will not glaze over and ignore it but understand it. The various accents that they hear in different films will not just be funny ways people talk but will carry meaning and help identify where the speaker comes from.
What’s your newest superpower, you might ask your kids after each lessonlet: “I cut vegetables with a knife. I can build a snow man. I can count to ten in Chinese. I can whistle. I can play foosball. I know what “locomotion” means. I know the capital of America. I know the world’s fastest fish. I know why the sky is blue. I can bake cookies. I know the traditional iconographic schema employed by Flemmish "primitives" in 15th century proto-Realist paintings like Jan van Eyck's triptych, Adoration of the Mystic Lamb. You name it, anything is possible!


Okay, that's really it for now. Thank you for your interest and support. May your kids have the superest of superpowers and may you all be healthy and happy...

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are no risks whatsoever with this project. The book is 75% written, and so just needs finishing touches, an edit and design and layout. We’re doing it all in-house (the author’s wife is doing design, layout and illustrations, the author’s mom is the editor) and the plan is to publish via Amazon KDP, which means that the printing and posting will be automated and should work smoothly and efficiently, even in Corona Time (which is why we’re avoiding traditional printers, as most are closed). I suppose the only real risk is in a delay in getting the book to you because of Corona Time slowdowns. But there’s a reason we have this very low Kickstarter target. We don’t need an injection of capital to launch a new product. This is just a way for you to get a super-discounted price on pre-orders of this book. We’re hoping the whole book will be finished by the end of the campaign and so we can upload it and have it sent out to you very soon after the campaign has ended. The only aspect of the project that needs funding is the development of the App. This will kick in if we hit our second Stretch Goal of 4000 backers. The App would take more time to make, likely at least six months, but you can get started with the book straight away!

campaign.story:
"... Much of the well organized and easy to understand rule book is taken up by examples of movement and finding firing solutions using Forsage’s unique 'Triangle Movement System'.
... I can safely say that this system works very well in simulating the maneuvers of these planes. ...
... There is so much to like in this game. ..."
- by Richard Martin in Armchair General magazine (This game has the right stuff!)
"... it's basically just use of logic.
...The guy is an aeronautical engineer, I think he knows what he's talking about ...
...It's a smart system.
...Ten minutes of reading the rules and you're playing the game.
...He has really thought of everything ... and again it's not complex at all.
...This is an easy game and it's deep. ..."
(One of the comments during live broadcast on YouTube:  "Loving this new wave of designers that free themselves from the shackles of tradition :) and make these innovative wargames.")
- in a radio show by Rob Oren and Dan Pancaldi
"... It’s all ultimately about position and that’s where this deceptively simple little game shines.
... What is most interesting is the “Gyroscopic Effect” that means planes with rotary engines have greater issues making left turns.
... It seems that they have a good feel for the possible outcomes with both fixed machine guns (MG), flexible nose mgs and dorsal mgs.
... If you have any interest in this era, Age of Dogfights will present you with the opportunity for many hours of both fun and tense gaming.
... Age of Dogfights is a professionally done product."
- by Robert Smith (Panzer Digest magazine) on BGG (link)
内容物を見るだけでワクワクが止まりません。ぜひともa-gamesで取扱いたい商品ですね！  ("Excitement does not stop after looking at the contents. It's definitely a product you want to have.")
- by Katsuhiro Matsui (コマンドマガジン Command magazine)
In this game, planes from the First World War meet in a battle. Simple rules of movement and firing include all the most important features of the aircraft of the time: speed, agility and firepower. Battles are lead at five different altitudes, so there are differences between the planes in terms of climbing and descending speeds. Some specific characteristics were also taken into account, such as gyroscopic effect, which gives some aircraft exceptional maneuverability. Wind influences movement and the position of the sun affects firing accuracy, so these factors are also taken into account. A plane under attack can escape into the clouds and thus hide from the enemy. Most of the pilots are average, but there are also rookies and aces.
The game contains as many as 54 plane pieces belonging to three countries: France, Germany, and Great Britain. Each country has 6 types of aircraft (3 pieces each) from different war periods.
In the initial period of WW1, most planes were single-engine two-seaters whose primary purpose was to observe and photograph enemy positions and background, but they also dropped bombs and fired at enemy aircraft when meeting in the air. As early as 1915, specific aircraft with special tasks appeared: fighting, reconnaissance, and bombing. Accordingly, there are three basic types of warplanes in this game, and their characteristics can be described as follows:
FIGHTERS are small, fast, and agile single-seaters. They can accelerate rapidly and they are armed with fixed machine guns that shoot straight forward in the axis of the aircraft. There are exceptions, however - two-seaters with additional dorsal machine guns (Bristol F.2 Fighter and Hanriot HD.3).
SCOUTS are single-engine two-seaters, their primary task is to photograph enemy positions, which is why they have cameras. They also have fixed and dorsal machine guns, so they can fight as well, but they can't accelerate abruptly. They can also carry one bomb.
BOMBERS have two engines and carry two or three bomb markers. They also have flexible nose and dorsal machine guns, which can only be used defensively.
The expansion includes aircraft from other countries participating in the war, a total of 27 types (54 pieces).
WORTH OF CERTAIN AIRCRAFT TYPES
On all control panels, in the upper right corner, there is a number that indicates the worth of that type of aircraft. In the basic game, all fighters have similar values (from 6,5 to 7,5), with the exception of two extremes, Airco DH-2 (6) and Fokker D.VII (8). In the expansion, there are some older types from 1914-5 which are worth much less.
To calculate the value, we made a formula that takes into account all the characteristics of the aircraft (in this game). Speed is an important factor, but agility is twice as important. Other characteristics of the aircraft (armament, gyroscopic effect, climbing speed, ...) were taken into account in an appropriate way. The results are quite realistic: the highest value is Fokker D.VII (8), followed by SPAD S.XIII, Sopwith Camel and Fokker Dr.I (7.5), while the worst are the slow Russian Mosca-Bystritsky Mbbis and sluggish Turkish Fokker D.I (4,5). For scouts and bombers, there is a worth for the empty aircraft and for the total value when carrying bombs (numbers in brackets).
These values do not affect the basic game, and they are used if you have the expansion. In some scenarios, you can choose a smaller number of planes with a high value or a larger number of those that have bad features (lower value). We believe that gamers will be interested in playing a game in which, for example, 8 Russian fighters try to protect the bombers from the attacks of 6 Austro-Hungarian fighters.
An Excel spreadsheet which contains the mathematical formulas we used can be downloaded from the webpage with the rulebook.
To make the basic game even more interesting, we have put together a rich list of goals and hopefully, all of them (or at least the majority) will be reached.

The rules in this game are very clear, simple, and logical. Our basic principle - 'MCMD' (Minimum Complexity, Maximum Diversity) is fully complied with, for which we have received confirmation from several relevant people:
"... it says 'minimum complexity, maximum diversity', and he's right on 100%." - Dan Pancaldi
Our original Triangle system for positioning and movement of the pieces is applied. Each rule is well and clearly explained and supported by an illustrated example.
"The Triangle Movement System gives a very organic feel of to the aircraft maneuvers." - Richard Martin
Towards the end of the rulebook, the basic game modes and several scenarios are explained. There are short paragraphs that connect certain rules with historical and technical facts, which helps the player immerse into the role of a pilot of a combat aircraft from WW1.
On the last page, the entire manual is presented in an abbreviated fashion, which only confirms how simple the rules are, and at the same time, how they provide huge opportunities for the battle to develop in a dynamic, interesting and realistic way. Experienced gamers will probably be able to play the first game only on the basis of that shortened version, but we recommend that you read the manual fully.
"Now I was already familiar with their air gaming system so it made the transition to play easier. But if I didn’t know the system already, I would have found the rules easy to understand and well laid out." - Robert Smith
Rulebook in other languages
We will do our best to provide rulebook translations to several languages in cooperation with backers. You can read more about it in update #9. For now, a translation into French, Spanish and Portuguese has been done and Japanese, Italian, Dutch, Polish and German has been agreed.
The whole series of Age of Dogfights games is intended as a simulation of pure aerial battles with fighters in the main role. For diversity, the kit features also the scouts and the bombers, whose primary battle goals are reconnaisance and bombing, while fighting with enemy aircraft is secondary.
DOGFIGHT
This mode features only fighter planes, and also scouts in the role of fighters. The goal of the game is simple - shoot down as many planes as possible. This mode includes a scenario "Intercept the General".
RECONNAISSANCE
Scouts have the lead role in this mode. The task is to reach the reconnaissance zone (Task Zone A, B, or C), to take photographs, and then return and leave the Combat Zone (in order to get the photo negatives to the airport). This mode includes a scenario "Flying High" scenario.
BOMBARDING
This mode has two variants: zone bombing and bomber breakthrough.
The zone bombing variant is very similar to the reconnaissance mode.
In the bomber breakthrough variant, they have task to go through the entire Combat Zone and exit the opposite side of the board (in order to carry out strategic bombing). Scenario: "Attack at Dawn".
COMBINED MODE
Players may arrange for the game to be played in combined bombarding-reconnaissance mode. First, the bombers should bomb the target zones. Afterwards, the scouts will photograph the results of the bombing.
In our games so far, we have never explicitly featured a solo mode, although some of them had all the prerequisites for that. We have to be honest and say that we have never played any other board game, nor have we read any of the rules in full (that is the reason for the originality of our games). Therefore, we are not sure how the rules for such a variant of the game should be written.
However, our friend and collaborator Richard Martin will make sure that this game gets the rules for solo mode too. He has already suggested a version of the rules for solo mode, which will soon be tested (you can find the latest version HERE). Rules for solo play will be included in the game set.
Judging by some relevant comments, this game can be very interesting even for only one player according to the already existing rules. Airplanes have different characteristics and you can always start a battle, say 3 against 3, to determine which type of airplane is better. Various scenarios are also possible, and they can be very interesting even if one player plays on both sides.
During the First World War, airships and tied observation balloons played an important role in air combat. Barrage balloons were also widely used. From the ground, machine guns and cannons fired at the targets in the air ...
All these elements are part of the Expansion, as well as 27 new types of aircraft from 6 countries. The brochure describes additional rules for the new pieces. Is it feasible to attack with fast Italian planes on targets in the Austro-Hungarian background that is sheltered by barrage balloons and defended with strong anti-aircraft fire? Do the large and slow Russian bombers have a chance against German fighters? The mixed French-Serbian squadron returns from a task with low ammunition and encounters a strong Bulgarian patrol ... There are a total of 10 scenarios in the brochure and we believe that you will be able to immerse into the role of a squadron leader on an important task ...
As in our previous campaigns we have a First day gift. It is a set of 12 pieces (6 x 2) of Turkish planes with corresponding control panels in a separate box. Everyone who pays for one of the options (except $1 and $10) in the first 36 hours of the campaign will receive this gift ( "Forsage" first day lasts 36 hours! :) )
You have enough time to decide and pay for this game, which will give you a valuable reward.
After that, this set of pieces will be able to be ordered through the pledge manager BackerKit for the price of $ 10.
Add-ons can be selected in a subsequent preorder campaign on BackerKit (pledge manager).
Additional board ($8)
Estimated weight: ~0,65kg
An additional set of 3 board bi-fold segments with 4 board extensions and 6 task zones.
The board is designed in such way that it can be continued to any of the four sides, just by placing another board next to it. That way, a very large battlespace is formed (126x70cm or 140x63cm).
"Additional Aircraft Types" ($30)
Estimated weight: ~0,5kg
40 new aircraft types (80 pieces and 40 control panels)
When choosing the aircraft that will represent the countries participating in the First World War, we tried to choose the most important types from different periods of the war. The main game includes planes from Germany, France and Great Britain.
The main Expansion includes planes from Austria-Hungary, Russia, Italy, USA, Bulgaria (German planes), and Serbia (French planes). These countries had a much smaller number of aircraft types in use, so we chose only 5, 4, or 2 aircraft types for some of them.
In total, this basic game (18 types) + first day gift (6 types) with Expansion (27) and possible stretch goals (1 to 15) will possibly have as many as 66 different types of planes! That is more than enough to enjoy the game, but there are many more planes, especially from Germany, France and Great Britain that had a significant role in the war. It might be interesting for some gamers to try some of them in air battles, so we decided to optionally offer another game add-on that would contain various airplanes. You can read more about it in the Update #7 and Update #13.
Our preliminary proposal was to feature 30 types of aircraft (fifteen each for Central Power and the Entente, with two pieces and a control panel for each type), but it will be increased to 40 types. There may be fighters, scouts, bombers, various prototypes and experimental aircraft among them. The planes with the most backers' votes will be represented.
"Important Aircraft Supplement" ($24)
Estimated weight: ~0,45kg
Based on some suggestions, we are introducing another add-on where only the most important types of aircraft would be repeated, but in a larger number of 3 pieces per type. In that way, some larger air battles could be simulated, where the most common aircraft participated. The final list of types of aircraft that should be represented will be specified in a special update.
A current proposal for the content is that the three countries (Germany, Great Britain and France) have 6 types of airplanes with 3 pieces each (54 aircraft pieces, 18 control panels and 30 altitude stands).
The planes would be: Fokker E.III, Albatros D.III, Albatros D.V, Fokker Dr.I, Fokker D.VII and Albatros C.III   //   Sopwith Camel, Sopwith Pup, Royal Aircraft Factory S.E.5, Bristol Fighter F.2, Royal Aircraft Factory F.E.2, Royal Aircraft Factory R.E.8   //   SPAD S.VII, SPAD S.XI, Nieuport 17, Nieuport 24, Morane-Saulnier AI and Nieuport 12. So, in total, this add-on will have 54 airplane pieces. There will also be altitude stands in the set, 5 of each height (30 in total).
Ottoman Empire aircraft ($10)
Estimated weight: ~0,3kg
A set of 12 pieces (6 x 2) of Turkish planes with corresponding control panels.

The first concept for a board game by the author Predrag Lazović was about air combat. It was Saratoga (designed 1993, released ‘96). This is where our original Triangle system for positioning and moving pieces came to life. In later years, a dozen games were created, mostly featuring modern jets.
In the desire to make a game with the emphasis on air battles, "Dogfight" was created. This game simulates aerial warfare during WW2. Age of Dogfights WW1 is the direct successor of these games.
We decided to make a whole series of Age of Dogfights games that will cover the period from the very beginning of air battles until today.
Logically, the first in the series is a game that features WW1. In addition to the expansion offered during this campaign, we plan to make an expansion with aircraft from the 1920s soon. The rules would be the same, and the planes themselves very similar (though much faster) to the planes from WW1.
The next game will be Age of Dogfights: WW2. The rules will be similar but more advanced and adapted to newer planes. For example, 3 dice will be used for shooting and damage resistance of the planes will also be a factor (it is not the same whether you shoot at fragile "Zero", "Betty", etc. or at Spitfires, Messerschmitts, etc. or at robust Il-2, P-47, B-17 ...).
The third in a row will be the game Age of Dogfights: Transonic Era. For me as a big fan of aviation, this is the most interesting period. This game will include all transonic aircraft and the first few supersonic ones: F-11, F-100, F-102, Super Mystère, and MiG-19. The rules will differ from the previous ones to reflect the progress: higher speeds, engine afterburner, air-to-air missiles and Mighty Mouse rockets, ...
The final game, Age of Dogfights: Supersonic Era will feature all supersonic aircraft from F-101 and Mirage III to F-18 and MiG-31 ... There will be a major expansion in which all Stealth aircraft will be represented, both existing and those in development.
All in all, we, as authors, have set ourselves the difficult task of preparing all these games with expansions and various additions in the future. This work will be a pleasure for us because we believe that the originality of our concept will attract a large number of gamers who will enjoy this and the subsequent games.
After 4 successful projects on Kickstarter, we can say without restraint that we have never played any other board game except our own! That is the reason why our games are original and fresh in the world market. Airplanes and history have been our preoccupation since childhood, we have a large number of professional books and magazines, we study very seriously the period to which our wargames refer. We are extremely pleased that our passion and hobby has turned into a serious business. The Japanese print magazine Banzai dedicated the cover and seven more pages to us as authors and to our games. In that interview, we explained our motives and inspiration for creating games, and you can read it HERE.
Shipping fees from Serbia to other countries are quite high, so we will subsidize the costs by about 30%. We have favorable agreements with DHL and UPS and we plan to ship most of the packages through them, which means they will reach the recipient within a couple of days. We have provided "friendly" shipment status for EU member states, the USA and Japan. If the number of backers in the UK, Canada, Australia, and China is large enough, we will provide the same status for those countries as well.
The shipping price of each pledge depends on the country to which it is shipped and the weight of the package. The shipping fee will not be charged during Kickstarter, but only in pledge manager (BackerKit). That way, the shipping fee will be calculated after you complete your order (you may add various items then) according to the total weight of the order. The table shows the shipping fees:
For example, a single copy of the game Age of Dogfights: WW1 weighs approximately 1.6 kg, and the Expansion weighs about 0,5 kg. So, AoD + Expansion falls into the ''up to 2,5 kg'' category.
Add-ons section show the rough weights so you can estimate what the shipping costs will be if you purchase add-ons in the pledge manager.
This project is very important to us for the further progress of our small company. During the campaign, we will regularly publish updates related to stretch goals, possible add-ons, and other important topics. We are open to various suggestions and accept the possibility that we have missed some characteristics of certain types of aircraft and we will gladly adopt remarks that have a foundation.

                   We will try to answer all questions, either as a reply to the comment or in the FAQ section or within some updates.

                   We hope to have backers from all parts of the world, so we expect comments at different times of the day (during all 24 hours). We will post answers to questions and comments as soon as possible, but keep in mind that sometimes there will be a delay of several hours.
We believe that communication with backers will make this project better and more complete to the satisfaction of both us authors and the public.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our fifth project already. We have gained a huge amount of experience during the previous projects and we have also expanded significantly our own production facilities.

As always, we put a low target for our campaign, because in our workshop we can produce small and medium series of any game. In case several thousand games need to be produced, we will hire associates who helped us produce over 3500 Tank Chess copies along with expansions.

This game is very easy to produce. It contains many elements, but for almost all of the cardboard ones, we already have tools for cutting. Plastic parts (stands) are very easy to manufacture. For a series of a few hundred games, the 3D printers we already have are enough, and for larger series, a plastic injection tool will be made. That tool is extremely simple, because one side is completely flat, and the other has only two protrusions.

We have set the deadline for the delivery of games in January 2021. As far as production is concerned, we are sure that it will be fulfilled, and we even believe it will be much earlier.

The shipping of various goods has become quite complicated in recent months due to the Covid pandemic. We are following the situation and adapting to the current circumstances. We have contracts with DHL and UPS and we believe that there will be no problems during the shipping phase of this project.

updates.update_userinfo: All the rewards have been sent

We sent the last 15 packages today. There are only two large packages of several tens of kg left for retailers, which will be sent in a few days. We will report all tracking numbers in the next 2 days (the weekend).

GAMES AND EXPANSIONS

updates.update_userinfo: Status, compensation for taxes and the new project
updates.update_content: We have already announced in comments that on April 8, we sent the last order which doesn't contain the "1920s" expansion. We also said that there was a short-term break in production. Our associates: Lucky Graf (printing house) and Alfaplast (print finishing) are small companies with which we have been cooperating for years. They suddenly got one big well-paid job that needs to be done urgently. They asked us if they should accept it because we had already ordered and paid for sheets to be made for the "1920s" aircraft expansion. Due to the long-term cooperation during which they also made concessions to us many times, we agreed that they should finish the job first and then continue to work on our sheets. In these times of crisis, we have to show solidarity, and I hope that the backers will not resent us for the fact that deliveries will be delayed a bit. We should get those sheets in the next few days, and then in our workshop, we’ll manage the assembly and shipping in parallel.

We have to give a comprehensive answer to the questions related to taxes and "EU friendly" status, so we are posting an update about it.

Prior to our first Kickstarter project (2016), we requested information from customs related to taxes (in the EU and other countries). The answer was that Serbia, as a candidate for EU membership, has signed an agreement with the EU according to which no fees are charged if the goods are produced in Serbia. That is why we had wrote that the project has EU friendly status. At that time, we had only about 40 backers from the EU, but still we sent all the games in one shipment to a company in Germany, which then sent packages to individual backers. However, the German customs have charged the import tax then! To our question why, we received the answer that this agreement between Serbia and the EU is non-binding, and that some countries respect it while some not always.

For our next project (Tank Chess), we sent the packages directly from Serbia to the backers. We used regular Mail (for small packages up to 0.5 kg), DHL and Post Export service. Post Export uses an agreement between the State Posts of different countries, and we are told that for shipments sent that way no taxes are charged. At that time, we had over 1000 backers from the EU. We have information that only a small percentage of them paid a fee – if the package went by regular mail or via DHL.

In the announcement of this project, we wrote that the status of EU friendly has been secured. We had two options: to send packages through a fulfillment company from Slovenia, that respects the agreement between the EU and Serbia. The second option was, if there weren't enough backers from the EU to make fulfillment service profitable, to send packages via Post Export. There were enough backers, but we found out that the agreement between Serbia and the EU has not been applied since January (and some countries even earlier), and that taxes are always charged when goods are sent from one company to another! When a package is sent to an individual, each customs office decides for each package individually whether to collect customs tax or not. That is why we send all shipments to the EU via Post Export directly to backers. We still don't have complete information on the number of cases in which customs duties have been collected.

The corona epidemic is the reason why now almost all countries charge regular and some even additional taxes, because a way is being sought to fill the budgets. Our friends from Serbia, who had their successful campaigns recently, decided to produce the games in China. They knew immediately that the taxes would have to be paid when the goods entered the EU, so they collected all the taxes in advance. We did not charge anything in advance, because we believed that no one would pay the fees, because we produce games in our workshop (in Serbia). We even took it upon ourselves to subsidize shipping fees by about 30%. We did not count on the fact that the shipping prices will be increased by 5.5–8.7 USD from January 1. In addition, the packages are much heavier than the original estimate, which is why we pay a much higher price than expected. Fortunately, at least we did not have any large unplanned costs in production.

This situation is new for both us creators and the backers. We are sorry that fees are charged, but, according to the data we have collected so far, this rarely happens. For the next project, we will have to seriously consider how to solve this problem in advance. We will also try to find a way to somehow compensate the fees that our backers had to pay.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping status and support to our friends
updates.update_content:
We inform the backers that we have continued to send packages. From this week, we believe that we will send 150 packages per week.

We have announced in advance that we charge shipping fees slightly less (by 4–10 USD) than the actual. However, as of January 1, both Post Express and DHL have increased their prices. Depending on the weight of the package and the destination, the price increase ranges from 5.5 to 8.7 USD.

Our estimation for the weight of the basic game (with transport package) was around 1.7kg, but the actual weight is 1.97kg. The increased weight is from many achieved stretch goals and better (and heavier) materials compared to the prototype. Because of this, some packages have moved to a more expensive shipping category. Due to all of the above, our shipping costs have increased a lot, but that is part of the risk that each of the creators accepts when starting their project.

On the accompanying documents with each package, we write much lower prices for both games and shipping fee. The reason is a daily limit in values that we can send packages. With a lower value for each package, we can send more in one day.

There was a short interruption in shipping. We have resolved the issue and will resume shipping shortly.

The interruption was due to errors on the printed sheets. We noticed some mistakes in prepress back in November and they were corrected immediately. On one sheet with bomb and photo markers, the letters A, B and C, in transfer between computers, were accidentally converted into the wrong font (Cyrillic letters). Our co-worker who printed the sheets did not notice it in time, so the sheet was printed with an error. A similar error occurred on one sheet on which the main expansion control panels were printed. Here, the inscriptions on the control panels for observation balloons have also been converted into a different font. See pictures below.

updates.update_userinfo: New project announcement - Age of Dogfights: WWII
updates.update_content:
Back in the period when we announced the campaign for Age of Dogfights: WWI (AoD1) on Facebook, there was more interest in a game covering aerial warfare in the Second World War. However, we wanted to follow the order by starting the Age of Dogfights series from the beginning.

Since it is certain that we will send all AoD1 games during January and February 2021, we want to announce a campaign for Age of Dogfights: WWII (AoD2) in this update and invite backers to follow our further activities on that project.

The rules of the game AoD2 will be very similar to the rules for AoD1, with changes related to the newer aircraft (higher speed, better weapons, etc.). Because of this, the new game rules will be somewhat more complex, but on the other hand some elements will be simpler. For example, WWII aircraft did not use rotary engines (gyroscopic effect), and dorsal machine guns weren't used offensively (there will be fewer positions for offensive firing).

The rules of movement are basically the same, with some key improvements. The number of steps that an aircraft moves is still determined by the sum of its basic and the rolled number on a die. A novelty is introduction of four different blue dice with different range of numbers. Those are , , and die. The green die remains - (limited usage). This gives much more flexibility for aircraft movement.

We are informing you that we sent the first small number of packages on Tuesday, December 29. Tracking numbers have been sent to all recipients. After Orthodox Christmas, we will continue shipping. Most of the packages will be sent in the second half of January, and some will remain for February. PnP files will be ready during January.

Follow our further updates, we will announce the next project soon.

We congratulate all the bakers on the New Year 2021.

campaign.story:
HOW IT WORKS
When we prepare fermented vegetables we need to follow some basic principles. This innovative fermenter is set out to provide you with the tools for traditional fermentation that you can easily master.   
Glass weight with a pressing spring holds down the veggies to make sure all the air bubbles caught in the jar can flow up. 
You can pump out the excess air in the jar. Oxygen-free environment helps the good bacteria to thrive.
Mark the date of starting fermentation with built-in fermentation clock and let live organisms do their magic.  
Veggie Fermenter keeps your ferment safe with the one way valve technology. This enables air to come out but not into your ferment.  
It forces the gas out once the pressure builds up. No risk of bottle explosion, no burping the jars needed! 
It catches bad smells that form during the fermentation and efficiently neutralises them with active carbon felt filter positioned on the top lid. 
With stackable top lids you can save space in your pantry by stacking the jars one on top of the other. Who doesn’t need more space?   
SUSTAINABLE
Preserve the vegetables when they are in season and you can’t keep up with them. With fermentation you can store them in the fridge for months. Making small batches of ferment is convenient because you can actually put vegetables and fruits directly from the garden to the fermenting jar. This is an important step to self-sufficiency. You can actually make sure you are never without important nutrients, even when food is not in season or you don’t have access to the stores, etc.
VEGGIE FERMENTER SIZES 
INCLUDES 
COLORS 
REWARDS
You will choose the colors of the lids in a post-campaign survey! 
STRETCH GOAL: $55.000
Tongs & pounder hybrid
Kitchen tool for adding the vegetables and pressing them down in the jar. When we reach the $55k goal, every Kefirko Veggie Fermenter will include this item.

TIMEPLAN
WHY WE NEED YOU
Do you want to eat healthy food rich in good bacteria? Even more, do you want to eat food that is grown locally or in your own garden? And do you want to eat them all year long? With Kefirko Veggie Fermenter you are a step closer to being self-sufficient and to eating nutritious fermented foods that are prepared in your own home. To make this happen, you can play an integral role in the development. With your support we will be able to produce the molds that are needed to manufacture the final product. Join us on our third Kickstarter journey: support our campaign and spread the word!
Thank you, 
Kefirko Team


REVIEWS

This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1,100+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $460M raised between them.

campaign.story:
In the midst pandemic we have decided to present you an already-rolling project, which will enable us to work together with the common aim of fighting the virus that is taking human lives all over the planet.
By joining our forces to find the best solution to this problem, we realised that a tool is needed which will make it possible to avoid unnecessary bare hand contact in everyday errands.
Everyday objects such as light switches, door handles, trolleys and similar are constantly exposed not only to contact, but also to other influences such as coughs and sneezes that can easily transmit the virus to you.
All around the world potentially contaminated surfaces are touched more than 200 times per day.
Virus Reminder - Always at Hand
With every purchase we donate one Corohook to the people who need it the most.
We will be very grateful for your help in any kind of way, and in the case of orders, we will provide immediate delivery after a successful project, or even sooner, which will be announced in our updates.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
1) Products

IAMRUNBOX MINI 

We have been working on the IAMRUNBOX MINI for over a year now and after four prototypes and several tests, we have finally reached the desired results. We are confident that it will please active people all over the world.

SHOPPING BAG

Each shopping bag is made from a sustainable material that is produced of 4 recycled plastic bottles. We completed a small trial order with our sourced fabrics in China and Sweden, where we tested all processes to get ready for mass production.

RUNMASK

Transparency is one of your core values, and we want to be clear about the benefits and shortcomings of our RunMask.
 
It’s important to clarify that no mask provides 100% protection against COVID-19. Also, the effectiveness of this particular mask has yet to be tested.
 
Still, we did base on scientific research for the choice of the materials. As demonstrated by researchers from the Argonne National Laboratory and the University of Chicago (USA), the combination of cotton with other fabrics, including synthetics, can effectively (70-80%) filter aerosol particles that could transmit the COVID-19. The RunMask is made from multi-layered cotton and polyester which ensures proper protection via electrostatic-based filtration. 

Furthermore, the RunMask can be used as a cover placed over a medical-grade as it has a compartment that fits a KN95 filter inside. This enhances protection and prolongs the filter’s usable life if used correctly (right fit to the face).
 
Last but not least, the design of the RunMask is ergonomic, size-adjustable, and weather-resistant, which makes it perfect for outdoor activities.

2) Delivery

Getting products delivered on time is a priority for us. We have years of experience in manufacturing, quality control, and logistics, and have successfully produced and delivered similar products in the past. Also, this is our fifth Kickstarter campaign, and are we confident that our backers will love it as much as our previous products.

However, we cannot guarantee that there will be no delays in delivery due to the COVID-19 situation. Just keep in mind: we are working hard and doing our best to keep our promise.

Whatever challenges we face, our number one goal is to deliver high-quality products on time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
COVID-19 has devastated the world and taken the lives of so many people. Thousands of businesses have shut down and stopped operations. The virus has caused millions of people to lose their jobs and source of income to take care of their families. The world will feel the impacts of COVID-19 for years to come. How could this have been avoided?
For the longest time, we have been reading, "Employees must wash their hands" at our favorite restaurants, bars, airports, train stations, sporting venues, shopping malls, hospitals, and hotel bathrooms. Why should employees only be required to wash their hands?
We are on a mission to promote global cleanliness with the launch of  "Everyone must wash their hands".
Our Kickstarter is to help fund production and manufacturing for signs and magnetic bumper stickers and wristbands.  We plan to start shipping in September of 2020.
Once we formally start operating and selling, we plan on donating 25% of net income to global charities that focus on helping people impacted by the COVID-19 virus. No money raised through this Kickstarter campaign will directly be donated to charity.
What inspired this Kickstarter?  Nick is the founder and CEO of Bookkeeper360, an accounting platform for small businesses. Bookkeeper360 services hundreds of small business clients across the United States and has been recognized by INC. 5000 and Forbes. After seeing the devastation and impact the COVID-19 virus had on Bookkeeper360's clients, Nick woke up at 4:30 AM one morning, filed a trademark, and decided to launch this initiative to promote global cleanliness. In addition, Nick's family is in the restaurant business, which happens to be one of the most highly impacted industries by the COVID-19 pandemic.
Magnetic Bumper Sticker
Wrist Bands

campaign.story:
Let's face it. Bacterias are everywhere. There is a lot of surfaces that many people touch multiple times a day. These include:
· Opening doors
· Pressing elevator buttons
· Pressing light switches
· Pressing keypad
· Turning water facets on and off
While washing your hands and using hand sanitizer helps, even if you pay attention to all of the surfaces you touch, it is almost impossible to clean your hands without touching anything else. Let's take responsibility and protect ourselves as individuals and the society from getting sick and try not spread all of the bacterias unconsciously.
Because we believe it is our duty as individuals to be responsible to ourselves, family, friends and our society. Our focus is to prevent spreading bacterias all over the places and that is the reason, that we've inventend Safepoint.
THE BACK STORY
In the past few months the world has shifted in a ways no one could have predicted. Covid-19 came by suprise and turned our lives upside down and in response to that we have become even more germ conscience then ever. In this hard times our top priority is to keep ourselves, our families, friends and all of the society healthy  and safe by staying home and abiding the instructions we have been given. But sometimes we just have to go out, if nothineg else we have to buy groceries and that is the time when we are highly exposed to germs and viruses.
Do not let history repeat itself and do something to make a world a better place by being responsible. Take care. Use Safepoint.
Our campaign starts in April. Hopefully it will finish successfully funded in May. In that case we will start the production in June. As our suppliers are on standby we hope to start the first shipments beginning of July.
We can’t thank you enough for checking out our project and helping us make a world a safer place.

campaign.story:
About 3 months ago, I was watching a thriller called “Contagion”. The movie is about a fictional story of a pandemic, and the whole world is desperately searching for a cure against an aggressive virus. After that movie, I said: “I hope that never happens in real life!” Unfortunately, it did happen somehow.
That is why we decided to design a product that will help you to stay safe. Around us, there are many viruses and will always be. Our multifunctional carabiner will enable you to do everyday tasks in a safe and easy way.
The Stay Safe carabiner can be used as a door opener, stylus, key carabiner, quick fixer and a box opener.  Carabiner give us quick access to all the functions. It can be clipped on your pants or purse. Because of the germs transmission, we do not recommend carrying it in your pocket. 
Patent pending design

FUNCTIONS
1. CARABINER
The carabiner give us quick access to all the functions and to not carrying it in the pocket. Clip it on your pants, bags or purse. In these days nobody wants to touch the door handle with a hook or a hand and then put it in the pocket. And we recommend, that when you wash your hands, wash also the carabiner.
2. DOOR HOOK
The door hook gap is 2inch (5cm), which will definitely work perfectly with all the standard door handles. 
3. STYLUS
On the carabiner there are 2 points that can be used as a stylus. Every key pad, elevator button, touch screen situation will show you which one to use. 
4. BOX OPENER
In these days, we are all trying to avoid going to the shops, so online shopping is working on full capacities. Because we know, we got many packages these days, we added the function of a box opener, which is very needed in these days. 
5. HEX DRIVER
If you will need any quick fix, hex driver is added on a carabiner. 
THE BACK STORY
In our daily lives, we are constantly touching different public objects and surfaces, like door handles, elevator switches, keyboards, toilets, faucets, kettles, doors, soap dispensers, etc...
We know that all the cleaning stuff is working hard on cleaning all the public surfaces, however that is a never ending story. All of us have to consider, what we can do for our own protection.  
The whole world has fallen into a situation, where we are all more conscious about germs and public surfaces.  Did you ever find yourself in front of the door and trying to find a way to open without touching it? Well... we have and that is why we decided to make a tool for solving some of those problems. 
 How it is made? 
Stay Safe carabiner is made out of 99% COPPER, which is fully recyclable. COPPER is a natural antimicrobial material, therefore is a perfect material for our product. The carabiner spring is made out of stainless steel. 
The carabiner is cut with a Water-jet machine. After we cut the basic shapes, we continue with manual work like sanding, sharping the edge for a box opener, assembling, packaging.

campaign.story:
Why chew when you can slurp?  
 Why slurp wastefully when you can slurp sustainably? 
Our goal is to help people be healthier, while supporting their community and the planet. Smoothies are great, but can be inconvenient, and wasteful. Orchard Smoothies changes all that.  
 How does Orchard Smoothies work? 
Easy peasy blend n' slurpy.
Step 1: Order online. Subscriptions or one-offs. Free delivery in our service areas. 
Step 2: Kits delivered to your door in glass jars, packed in insulated, reusable bags. 
Step 3: Didn't we tell you already - just blend n' slurp!! 
Step 4: Put containers back out on the next delivery day. 
Step 5: Keep blendin', keep slurpin'.  
Our recipes include nutritious, locally grown fresh fruits and veggies as well as boosts to keep you focused, energized and healthy. Delivered in zero-waste, reusable jars.
Why Orchard Smoothies are better?
This is not your who-cares-about-the-planet way to slurp. We are the greener and better alternative to services like Daily Harvest, smoothie bars or even making your own smoothies.  
Mainstream smoothie companies and even your everyday grocery store produce is sourced from around the world. The fruits and vegetables can sit in cold storage for up to 11 months - ending up losing nutritional value and taste. Ingredients in our kits are sourced from Texas (with some exceptions) and are never frozen so you are guaranteed freshness and high nutritional value.  
What We Need
We need your help so we can optimize our service and spread our message of mindful consumption and modern sustainability.
Your contribution would help us with working capital, building our team and expanding our delivery range. 
Flavors
Our smoothies are created collaboratively by chefs, nutritionists, local produce experts and slurpers like you! What makes our smoothies even more special are the boosts made up of medicinal herbs from around the world, and vegan protein powders - designed to enhance flavor and nutritional value. 
Our single serve kits are $7.99 per 16oz smoothie. Daily Harvest single serve kits are $7.99 per 8oz smoothie. Their smoothies are DOUBLE the price. What you are paying for are the ice-packs, the wasteful packaging and the long distance travel. Save the money and buy yourself a trip to a cool place :) 
Here are two of our featured smoothie kit recipes:
Purely Energizing: A burst of Texas grown apples are combined with other fresh ingredients to give you an energetic, nutrient filled start to the day. The aswagandha herb is known for fortifying adrenal functions and helping modulate stress levels.
Ingredients: Apples*, organic lemon juice*, organic celery, organic kale*, organic cucumber*, aswagandha herb and hemp protein.
         *grown within the state of Texas

Recommended liquid bases: Water, coconut water, milk, any nut milk

Benefits: Energy, Burning Fat, Reducing Stress, Fortifying Adrenal Functions
Purple Mint: When antioxidant laden blueberries mingle with power packed cashews, mint and arjuna herb, the result is a smoothie that is sure to satisfy while helping your heart’s oxygenation and modulate your cholesterol levels. *Contains: Nuts

Ingredients: Blueberries*, organic oranges*, mint*, organic cashews, organic dates, arjuna herb
         *grown within the state of Texas

Recommended Liquid Bases: Water, coconut water, milk, any nut milk

Benefits: Energy, Anti-Inflammatory, Better Skin, Modulate Cholesterol, Heart Health
The Blend N' Slurp Process


Some of the farmers who make our smoothie kits possible:
Crawford Orchard, Idalou, TX, G&S Groves, McAllen TX, Village Farms, Marfa, TX, Patty’s Herbs, Pearsall, TX, Lightsey Farms, Mexia, TX, Makewood Plantation, Huntsville, TX, Joe's Microgreens, Austin, TX
Things That Matter to Us 
Without supporting rural communities and their farmers, city life would look very different. With more and more people moving to cities, the demand for food and other goods is skyrocketing. The farmers we source our fruits and veggies from are right here in Texas, we bring their harvest to you in a way that makes your life easier and their business possible. 
Our glass jars come in 32oz and 16oz portions and are consistently reused throughout our smoothie kit process. 
In a world where single-use packaging is everywhere, we believe Orchard Smoothies has potential for real impact. There will be as much plastic waste in the oceans as there are fish, by 2050. Not what we want those fishies to be slurpin' on! 
Tested, and Ready to Roll 
We have already been testing the concept in partnership with Lettuce (a zero-waste meal kit delivery service). Here’s some feedback we’ve received:  

We put all this feedback and more into a blender, slurped it all down, and the result is this final Orchard Smoothies experience.
With your contributions we can make zero waste the new norm not only in Austin but communities all over. The environment needs all the help it can get, so the little things add up. We believe that small changes equals collective impact. One smoothie kit at a time. 
Operationally speaking, powered by our technology partner, Loconomy, we will use Lettuce's operational infrastructure and delivery network to create and deliver our kits to customers - further reducing wasteful use of resources and helping make our business model more robust.  
About Me & Us
About 8 months ago I packed up my life and drove down to Austin from Philadelphia and took a chance at a new life. This is my first time living alone and it astounded me how much trash accumulated in such a small amount of time. I’m a big foodie, so being new to Austin I am constantly bombarded with food and drinks at every turn. I found myself eating out more than I should and neglecting my kitchen at home, for either convenience reasons or pure laziness. How could I cut down on my waste but maintain that Austin lifestyle I love so dearly? Orchard Smoothies became the solution I didn’t know I needed. It combines the ease of delivery with healthy and waste free alternatives. The best part is I don’t have to take out my trash as often.
But this project is not just me, myself and I. Orchard Smoothies is made up of knowledgable chefs who work with us to make sure our smoothies are nutritious and delicious. An operations team that works very hard to perfect your kits and get deliveries out on time. And a support team ready to answer your questions or address issues. 
The appeal of smoothies for me is that there is a smoothie for everyone, and that reflects your experience here in Austin. You're consuming something that isn’t a big brand, isn’t a ploy for money or your data but something that aims to provide you with a food experience that won’t leave you guessing. No matter who you are, we have a smoothie for you. And this is just the start! 
I am always looking for advice, feedback and support from people like you. So please feel free to reach out, critique my words or applaud my cause, I’d love to hear from you. Thanks for taking a chance with me.

campaign.story:
Hi, we’re Barbara and Nika and together we’ve created our friendship love-child Swimsor - a sustainable and ethical swimwear brand focusing on timeless design and ultimate comfort!
Our swimwear is made from recycled fishing nets and thus supports the health of our oceans. Designed and produced in Slovenia, Swimsor also builds the local economy. We've designed it for anyone and everyone who’s passionate about our planet, or just enjoys looking good strutting down a beach, feeling comfortable and confident.
We’ve always been passionate about maintaining the health of our planet but also building inclusive communities of women from all walks of life. We’d love for you to join our group of like-minded individuals! 
            ***GIVEAWAY***
Pledge/Pre-Order before Tuesday, March 17th, to be included in a giveaway for one Swimsor top & one Swimsor bottom of your choice! The winner will be announced at the end of the Kickstarter campaign. Giveaway is contingent on reaching (or exceeding!) the fundraising goal.
Our goal is to build a brand that’s fully transparent while raising awareness of ocean pollution and endangered marine species. The fabric we use is made out of recycled fishing nets and other nylon waste, which makes it way better for the environment. We made sure our material and production comply to high quality standards, so you can enjoy our bikinis for years to come. 
We’ve been working on prototypes for over a year to ensure the perfect fit yet still provide the most comfort. All of the designs and prints are made in-house, so they’re exclusive to the Swimsor collection. Our pieces are super comfortable and beautifully timeless.
The first collection presents 3 different styles of tops and 3 of bottoms. They all come in two different colors giving you plenty of options to mix & match the shape and color that suits you best!

           See all the different ways you can wear our bikinis

 Don't need a bikini but still want to support us? 
We've prepared other options, in case you're not in need of a bikini, but still want to support us and be a part of our story 💖
“Discover your purpose” digital workbook
  Swimsor prints (14 x 20cm)
Skin brush (with pdf instructions of how to use it)
How does pledging work?
To pledge means to back up our campaign by purchasing one of the rewards we offer - these are different discounted offers and packages, like our early bird bikini set, our self-care package and so on. There are different rewards ranging from $5 up to $319, so you can support our campaign in any way that fits your budget. You can view all of our rewards on the right side of our campaign page.
How to pledge?
1. Click “Back this Project”: Select the available reward tier you would like to pledge on the right side of the page. Each backer may only make one pledge.
2. Payment: Enter your payment information. You won't pay or choose any model at this point, you are only allowing Kickstarter to charge you the cost of the pledge at the end of the campaign if we reach the initial goal.
3. Model, Color & Shipping Information: Don’t worry about that yet! You will receive a survey to tell us your favorite model, color, size and shipping information once the campaign is over.
To all Backers: We will ship worldwide via trackable post. International shipping is $5. Please note that you may be 100% responsible for duties, fees, and taxes applicable to your region. Funding on Kickstarter is all-or-nothing. You will not be charged for a pledge towards our project unless it reaches its funding goal.
Remember! You are not only making a pledge for a bikini, you are helping 2 girls achieve their dreams.
Our plans for the future:
We’re expanding our collection and creating swimwear that can be worn by women of all shapes and sizes. One of our main goals is to be inclusive and to create a community where every woman feels represented. 


Check out our video campaign for the first collection
#Istartwithmyself
 Every year there are 640.000 tons of fishing nets dumped and discarded in the sea, which entangle and trap more than 100.000 marine animals and destroy their habitat. Experts estimate that more than half of the garment workers in the world are not payed the legal minimum wage. Without any grand schemes or big moves, what can we do to help even in just the smallest way?
It is as simple as making the decision to buy clothing that doesn't cost us our world and the people living on it.

20 seconds of your time could make the difference in growing the Swimsor sisterhood and reaching our goal. Click one of the buttons below and tag a soul-sister that cares about the environment.

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We chose a fabric that is twice as resistant to chlorine, sunscreen, and oils than any other comparable swimwear fabric. We made sure our Slovenian production complies to high-quality standards.
Reusability and recyclability
Our swimwear is made from recycled fishing nets lost at sea, so it not only supports the health of our oceans but repurposes a material that would otherwise go to landfill. Our packaging is made out of compostable renewable plant-based materials like corn and will break down in a home compost in 180 days.
Sustainable materials
Econyl - Synthetic waste such as industrial plastic, waste fabric and fishing nets from oceans, are recycled and regenerated into new nylon yarn that is exactly the same quality as virgin nylon.
This regeneration system focuses on 6 steps that form a closed loop and uses less water and creates less waste and less nitrous oxide (which is 10 times more potent than carbon dioxide) than traditional nylon production methods.
Environmentally friendly factories
We chose a production that is close to home (100km to be exact) which substantially reduces CO2 emissions and supports our local economy. We personally know the people who work there and we can ensure that they are treated well and receive a fair living wage.
